Brooks -

Based on your result that it fails when setting mass fractions from a 
string, but works when setting mole fractions, I was able to locate a 
bug in the C++ code in function 'setMassFractionsByName' in file 
Phase.cpp.  Basically, a temporary array was being created to store 
mass fractions but was not properly initialized to zero.  I have now 
fixed this.  The problem may not have had anything to do with spaces 
after the commas after all.

I'm sorry that this bug wasn't caught earlier.  When using a string to 
specify the composition, I virtually always set mole fractions, and so 
this bug went undetected,. The corresponding function to set mole 
fractions from a string does not have this problem.

The fix has already been made in the CVS repository. I'll release a new 
binary installer for Windows in a couple of days with this fix along 
with fixes to the other problems that have been mentioned in messages 
recently.  Some significant new capabilities will be present too.


Dave
